thread.section_title: Massive ‘gas explosion’ sparks building collapse – Metro
thread.title: Massive ‘gas explosion’ sparks building collapse

author: georgiadiebelius1
title: Massive ‘gas explosion’ sparks building collapse
text:
A building has been flattened (Picture: Twitter/@TomDagnall) A ‘massive gas explosion’ has allegedly destroyed a building in New Ferry, Merseyside, this evening.
The explosion reportedly took place at a furniture shop at around 9.15pm.
Pensioner killed in London terror attack was Winston Churchill's window cleaner Pictures on Twitter shows the widespread damage and bricks scattered across the roadway.
It is currently unclear if there are any injuries.
Local radio station Capital FM said: ‘Explosion in New Ferry understood to be at a furniture shop… building flattened with other buildings around it suffering damage.’
More to follow.
